summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Santander Bank, demanding extensive financial records for a specific account holder for the period from January 1, 2018 onward. The subpoena is related to an investigation into alleged violations of federal statutes including bribery, conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction. It includes detailed instructions for record production and a procedure for cost reimbursement.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying reimbursement procedure letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Santander Bank to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, with this date set as the appearance date.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued to Santander Bank, formally initiating the demand for financial records.

locations: Santander Bank, 2 Morrissey Boulevard, Dorchester, Massachusetts 02125
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
U.S. Attorney's Office - SDNY Accounts Payable, 86 Chambers Street, 3rd floor, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks extensive financial records from Santander Bank for a specific, unnamed account holder for the period from January 1, 2018, onward.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal statutes including bribery (18 U.S.C. § 201), conspiracy (18 U.S.C. § 371), false statements (18 U.S.C. § 1001), and obstruction (18 U.S.C. §§ 1346, 1519).
The document includes a detailed rider specifying the types of records required, such as account statements, wire transfers, check images, and customer contact information.
The subpoena references a specific case or investigation number: Ref No. 2019R01059.
The account holder's name and Social Security Number are requested in the rider but are redacted in the provided text.
